key_points: Tiger Woods was involved in a rollover car crash on Tuesday, February 23.
He underwent a long surgical procedure on his lower right leg and ankle.
Woods is currently awake, responsive, and recovering in his hospital room.
Harbor-UCLA Medical Center and Los Angeles County Sheriff's and Fire Departments provided assistance.
Dr. Anish Mahajan stated Woods suffered significant orthopaedic injuries to his right lower extremity.
Injuries were treated with a rod in the tibia and stabilization of foot and ankle with screws and pins.
Woods' SUV collided with a median, crossed into oncoming traffic, and rolled over several times.
He was extricated from his vehicle using tools rather than the 'jaws of life'.
The vehicle was traveling at a greater speed than normal according to Sheriff Alex Villaneuva.
Woods had undergone five back surgeries since 2014 and hoped to return to golf in 2021.
spokespersons: Dr. Anish Mahajan (chief medical officer and interim CEO, Harbor-UCLA Medical Center)
